traffic lights.description: The traffic light ahead displays a green signal, indicating that the vehicle can proceed when it is safe to do so.
traffic lights.explanation: The green light allows this vehicle to proceed. If there are pedestrians, the driver must allow the pedestrians to pass before continuing to drive.

barriers.description: A movable barrier equipped with reflective strips and warning lights has been placed in the middle of the lane, seemingly narrowing the drivable road.
barriers.explanation: This obstacle indicates that there is road construction ahead or a change in traffic patterns, requiring self-driving cars to slow down or change lanes when necessary to ensure safe travel.

other objects.description: An obstacle marked with signs is placed in the middle of the road, which may indicate the presence of a pedestrian crossing or road construction ahead, visible under the illumination of the green traffic light.
other objects.explanation: Obstacles indicate that the normal driving path may be obstructed or altered, requiring the vehicle to slow down or prepare to detour.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic scene, the traffic light ahead is green, allowing vehicles to proceed with caution, especially if pedestrians are present. Additionally, there is a movable barrier with reflective strips and warning lights positioned in the middle of the lane, suggesting road construction or a change in traffic patterns. This requires vehicles to slow down or change lanes as necessary for safe passage. Furthermore, an obstacle marked with signs is present in the middle of the road, possibly indicating a pedestrian crossing or road construction. This obstacle, illuminated by the green traffic light, necessitates that vehicles reduce speed or be ready to take an alternative route. There are no vehicles, vulnerable road users, traffic signs, traffic cones, or other objects reported in the scene.

driving_suggestion: Even if the traffic light is green, pedestrians have the right of way, and self-driving cars should come to a complete stop to allow pedestrians to pass safely before proceeding according to the traffic light signal. Approach obstacles with caution and be prepared to stop or take a detour as indicated by the signs on the obstacle. Adjust your speed appropriately to ensure the safe passage around the obstacle, and stay alert to any additional instructions or changes in the driving environment.
